meanings.definition: The quality of being concise and expressing ideas clearly.
meanings.sent1: Her essay stood out due to its succinctness and clarity.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the succinctness of his speech; he gets straight to the point.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's succinctness in explaining the complex topic left the students amazed.
meanings.sent4: The succinctness of the instructions was like a ray of light in the fog of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The succinctness of the recipe made it easy for even beginners to follow.

meanings.definition: The act of being brief and to the point.
meanings.sent1: His succinctness in answering questions impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, we appreciated the succinctness of the presenter's report.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's succinctness in delivering jokes kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The succinctness of her apology spoke volumes about her sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The succinctness of the news article made it a quick and informative read.
